definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: The one eyed Wang Huaie directs the truth of how he framed and disc for Jing kui.
sentences.chinese: 獨眼龍將王懷鍔指使他如何陷害景逵的實情和盤供出。

sentences.english: Her fiance is a one-eyed man.
sentences.chinese: 她的未婚夫是個獨眼龍。

sentences.english: Maybe it's not right to do this to a poor, helpless one-eyed man.
sentences.chinese: 也許，這樣對待一個可憐的無助的獨眼龍是不對的。

sentences.english: Then a whole bunch of one-eyed men came rushing up.
sentences.chinese: 後來一羣獨眼龍衝過來了。

sentences.english: But just then a secon one-eyed man appeared.
sentences.chinese: 就在那時有一個獨眼龍出現了。

sentences.english: In the land of the blind, the one-eyed is king.
sentences.chinese: 在盲人的國度裏，獨眼龍就能稱王。

sentences.english: In the land of the blind, Duyan Long is King.
sentences.chinese: 在瞎子的國度裏，獨眼龍就是國王。

sentences.english: In the land of the blind, the one-eyed man is king.
sentences.chinese: 身處盲人之地，獨眼龍也可以稱王。

sentences.english: Just then the captain came out. He was an ugly man with only one eye.
sentences.chinese: 就在那時船長出現了，是個醜陋的獨眼龍。

definition: lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
to turn tears into laughter (idiom); to turn grief into happiness
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
erhua variant of 一股腦|一股脑[yi1 gu3 nao3]
after the calamity, renewed life (idiom); new lease of life
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
